start_office: ^(Can't sleep tonight. Cars, gun shots, everybody in town wants to drive me crazy.)
^("Come to San Francisco" they said. "It's like a Gold Rush for private detectives".)
^(Ain't nobody like Bugsy Rosenthal to look like a damn fool.)
^(Next thing I know, my wife leaves me, and I'm nearly all out of legit businesses.)
^(But everybody has to do something for a living.)
^(And this mob is paying quite well.)
^(But they're savages, killing each other and all.)
^(And now this stupid phone is ringing.)
^(Don't even want to answer, the hell with it.)

c-0: ^ (This damn phone ain't gonna stop itself.)

s0: ^(Ain't no time to call somebody, they'll wait tomorrow.)
s1: ^(Could be a business call... Who am I kidding?)

g-0: ^(I decide to get up and finally answer it.)

c-2: ^ Can't you see it's the middle of the night ?

g-1: ^It's <color=red>James Lanza</color>. We had a problem with <color=red>Giovanni</color>.

c-3: ^ God's sake, what time is it??

g-2: ^3AM, but we pay you to come even when you're shitting.
^You understand me Rosenthal? Come here right now.
g-3: ^98 Francisco Street . Hurry up, it stinks here.

c-6: ^ boy, it's the middle of the fucking night.

g-4: ^(I hung up and got out of bed.)
^(For God's sake, what did they do again?)

s0: ^(Not even the time for a coffee, I put on my hat and go outside to find a cab.)

g-5: ^(As I'm slowly starting to lose my temper and head back to the office, a 47' Cadilloc slows by.)

c-9: ^Ain't the time to joke Mr. Rosenthal.

g-6: ^I'm <color=red>Rossini</color>. Mr. <color=red>Lanza</color> sent me to get you, could you please get in the car?

c-11: ^. Couldn't he warn me that you were going to fetch me?

g-7: ^(As soon as I seat, my nocturnal driver starts the engine and takes me to Francisco Street.)
^(He rides smoothly and hardly ever speaks. Francisco is not so far, but he seems to take quite a lot of detours.)

s: ^Can't you go directly to the apartment?

c-0: ^Let's say that I tend to his protection.
c-1: ^ Is there any place left in North Beach?
^I'm not here to settle down, Mr. <color=red>Lanza</color> asked me to come to ensure his protection.

c-2: ^ He's not been linked to <color=red>Lima</color>, has he?
^Not that I know of, the boss was smart enough to make sure that the organization would not be too much harmed.
^I can't say anything, but I'm sure Mr. <color=red>Lanza</color> will talk to you about it.

c-14: ^Must make sure that we're not tailed sir.

c-0: ^ kid, <color=red>Jimmy</color> should have told you so.
^I'm a simple detective that helps some friends in need.
^Not you personally, but we must stay on our guard.
g-0: ^I don't get it, your boss <color=red>Lima</color> is judged, couldn't you find someone to take the blame?
^I don't know, that's not something that I was told.

s: ^Are you throwing me under the bus?
^<color=red>Lima</color> didn't request my help for the trial

c-1: ^ I'll not go down easily boy.
^Don't be stupid, Mr. <color=red>Lima</color> cannot be saved by you.
c-2: ^You're not here to help on that matter. The Administration is working on it.
^So where do I fit in your plan now?

g-8: ^(The ride continued in a complete silence.)
^(Giovanni is dead. Poor kid. And more Italians flooding North Beach.)
^(Something's wrong. And I'm gettin' mixed in all that.)
^I let you go by yourself. Mr. <color=red>Lanza</color> is waiting for you inside.

c-17: ^ Before I leave kid, can I ask you something?
^Am I being set up? Are they trying to ditch me to save their asses?
^Mr. Rosenthal, you're not important enough to worry yourself.

g-9: ^(I cross the threshold of the building and go to the second floor. Apartment 237.)
^(The night doesn't seem to be over yet.)
^(Jimmy Lanza is waiting for me, near to the door.)
^It's about time, ain't all Jew boys supposed to arrive on time?

c-18: ^greaseballs like you waiting for me at a crime scene.
^I'm not here to joke around, not with two bodies waiting two feet away.
c-19: ^, I don't have to come like a dog whenever you botch everything!
^You think I'm happy with this shit? I could have done without two more bodies.
c-20: ^, we have more important to do. Where is he?
^He? You mean them. We found a girl in the bathroom.

c-21: ^ I thought <color=red>Giovanni</color> was the only one.

g-11: ^We found a dead girl in the bathroom.

c-22: ^, you people really can't keep it in your pants.
^Show some respect, Rosenthal. We're not always gonna feed you.
c-23: ^ I heard Giovanni was a killer in bed, but ain't that exaggerated?

g-12: ^Someone killed them both, or they killed each other, but I don't think so.
^But you're the expert here! So what you gonna do?

s: ^I'll go and check on the bodies

c-2: ^We need to go Rosenthal. I'll take you to your office

c-0: ^He was made capo some months ago. Poor kid...
^The Administration chose him to take the place of <color=red>Lima</color> during the trial.
^So he was the one that was going to take the blame?

s: ^You mean that you decided to throw him under the bus.
^What did he do to deserve it?

c-0: ^No, we'll take care of his family.
c-1: ^Stop insinuating that we wanted him killed.

c-0: ^, and I don't see Giovanni around.
^We decided that together, with <color=red>Abati</color>, even with <color=red>Morello</color>.
^We agreed to tend for his family, at least for his mother.
^She's in Sicily. The boy came here on his own. Bloody American dream.

c-1: ^Can't say for sure, that's your job now. Nobody ever saw <color=red>Tommy</color> with her.
^But we were not following him day and night.

g-0: ^Don't be stupid. I keep a close watch on everyone.

c-0: ^How can you say that she had a boyfriend?
^<color=red>Giovanni</color> is Italian. You always look for trouble.
^You knew <color=red>Tommy</color> a little. A good-looking boy.
^They would fall in his arms in a flash.
^But always a gentleman with the ladies.

c-2: ^As you should know now, <color=red>Lima</color> was sent to jail, with a trial coming.
^<color=red>Abati</color> took his place, and I second him now.

s: ^Too much complication to take the power.

c-0: ^, Sotto-Capi. Is that your title now?
^That was meant to be temporary. We should have exonerated <color=red>Lima</color>.
c-1: ^Again, stop your accusations. We were close to freeing the Boss.
g-0: ^Now <color=red>Lima</color> is taking full power, and I'll second him the best I can.

c-2: ^But the old man now tries to stay out of it. He earned it.

check_apartment: ^(I enter the apartment, only to find a first body. Poor Tommy.)
^(Ok, let's focus now and do that methodically, ain't I a damn detective?)

c-0: ^(His skull is completely shattered, which is caused by the obvious bullet hole on his forehead.)
^(Skull and brain pieces are all over the wall behind.)
^(What does this poker chip doing here?)

g-0: ^(So now, where would I search for clues?)

c-1: ^(What happened here? It's a bloody slaughterhouse)
^(The entire floor is covered in blood. Hers, obviously.)

c-0: ^ (Let's have a look at the body.)
^(But not a lot of pretty girls have a deep cut across their throats.)
^(She didn't come with a lot of stuff. Except for a small lady bag.)
^ (Maybe I'll find out more about her here.)
^(No papers, only a key for a hotel room.)

c-2: ^ (Did they have enough time to use the bedroom?)
^(It's tidy, without a lot of furniture.)
^(Only a bed, an empty desk with only one paper on it, and a closet.)
^(The bed is still made. Giovanni didn't sleep here so much, or at least not yesterday.)

c-0: ^(But I know seems logical, the closet being nearly empty.)
^(Not enough for someone to live here.)
^(Unless that person is a slog. But Tommy was not.)

c-3: ^(Nothing more for me in that apartment.)

end_apartment: ^(Lanza, always keeping an eye on me, brought me back to my office on Broadway Street.)
^(That day could not have been worse.)
^(This freakin' mob is quite a mess.)
^(Let's check if I have all the hierarchy in order.)
^(So the boss Lima was imprisoned. His second, Abati, took his place.)
^(Abati is now at the head of the entire family.)
^(Jimmy Lanza is just behind him. As the underboss, he overlooks all the capi.)
^(Couldn't they say captains like every American?)
^(So each capo have soldiers under their orders.)
^(And then there is all the associates. Nice way to call all the Jews, Russians and scum working for them.)
^(Quite out of the game. He's only advising, never getting his hands dirty.)
^(What a mess... I should keep a diagram.)
^(So now, let's check what we have here.)
^(A mafioso that couldn't keep it in his pants, and got shot for it.)
^(Lima eliminated, and the entire organization turned upside down by it.)
^(And above that, this girl. We have nothing on her.)
^(Maybe that's what I should work on.)
^(Find who she is, where she lived.)

prostitute_motel: ^(That should be where the girl lived.)
^(I wouldn't stay here for a million bucks!)
^(But I have to go in now.)

motel_lobby: ^(The only client that come here exit the place immediately, only passing by.)
^(There's only this man. Seems to be the manager.)

c-0: ^ (Let's talk to him, that's my only lead.)

c-1: ^ Good day fellow, I want to access one of your rooms.

g-2: ^(He seems puzzled, as if I wanted to penetrate the White House.)
^And why would you want to go in there man?

c-3: ^ And why would you want to interfere in an ongoing investigation.
^(I see the fear in his eyes. That's not someone that wants to challenge the police.)
^(I could swear that he immediately peed his pants.)
^Oh... hum, ok sir, if you would follow me.
c-4: ^ She's my girl, but I don't have news from her for two days...
^Your girl... Why does she live alone then?

c-0: ^ Why don't mind your damn business?
^Alright, calm down... So many weirdos here...
c-1: ^Oh... I see... Alright old sport follow me.

g-4: ^(That slow man finally seems to trust me, and leads me through the maze that is this shitty motel.)

motel_room: ^I'll have to stay with you man, company's policy.
^No problem, just let me search for a few things
^(That's not what you would call a lady bedroom.)
^(Nearly no furniture. No personal effects. Only some clothes on the bed.)
^(That could make sense if she's a prostitute, she wouldn't have much time to sleep here.)

c-0: ^ (The bed takes nearly the entire room space.)
^(There's nothing worth noticing, except for the bedside table and a large closet.)
^ (This table is really the only remarkable object here.)
^ (Above the table, there's a little lamp.)
^(Beside it, an ashtray, full of cigarettes, and a little matchbox.)
^(What club could this fine lady go to?)
c-1: ^ (What could we find on the drawer?)

c-0: ^(Oh. 100 dollars. Big cuts only. Definitely a prostitute.)
^(But thanks for the money darling, you won't need it now.)

c-1: ^ (So now lady, what are you hiding in here?)
^(Only clothes, normal ones, but also some... enticing outfits.)
^(This only assures me that she's a working girl.)
^ (She seems to often use that desk given the number of papers.)
^(What are those? Seems to be letters from a relative.)
c-2: ^ Alright fellow, could I ask you something?

c-0: ^ Do you know what she did for a living?
^Didn't ask. I didn't have a reason to.
^If you have what's necessary to pay your room, you can stay.
^But she often went outside at night. Sometime someone would wait for her outside.
c-1: ^ Don't you happen to know her name?
^Not a lot of people come here under their real name.
^But I would not give it too much thought.

c-3: ^(I leave without giving him a chance to believe that I'm not with the police.)
^(Not too much about that girl... At least I know where she lived.)
^(But I still don't know anything else about her, not even her name. Let's work on that.)
^(Maybe Gibbs could help me on that.)
^(I hate to go to a cop, but let's face it, it as much a good cop as Lanza is.)
^(He could even betray his own mother.)
^(But he's useful. Let's go check on him.)
^What do you want from me this time Mr. Rosenthal?
^I couldn't find much on your wife, she's keeping a low profile right now.
^I'm not here for that Gibbs, I work for <color=red>Lanza</color> for now.
^I need to find the name of a girl, she was found with one of <color=red>Abati</color>'s men.
^Could you give me anything on her?
^Jesus, those Italians are always all guns out.
^I could check on our records, but I'll need her full name.
^Anyway, I'll get you the name of that girl.
^I'll help you with anybody Mr. Rosenthal, feel free to come by.
^(So now, where could I find that girl's name?)

condor_club: ^(So that's where the girl had her habits...)
^(Doesn't seem like a place where a girl could enjoy herself.)
^(And the men coming here should enjoy something different than their drinks.)

condor_entrance: ^(But it's just a nearly empty club.)
^(Only some sad men at the counter, and a barman cleaning its glasses.)
^(He sees me, and doesn't say a single word.)

c-0: ^(He will not approach me. Maybe I look too much like a cop.)
^(But I'll look like a fool if I leave now.)

b: ^ Put my last bill on the counter

s0: ^10 bucks should be enough to make him talk.
s3: ^40 freakin' bucks, I'm completely bankrupt now.

s0: ^Sir, can I have a word with you?

s1: ^It's like I'm just a robot handing bucks.
s2: ^I want to crack that vodka bottle on his head so bad.

s3: ^As I see my last bill going away, I'm quite eager now for that drink.

s0: ^Only to replace it with a glass of vodka.
s3: ^That doesn't taste so bad after all.

s1: ^Not a word. Just a half-full glass.
s2: ^I'm not drunk, but I'm not sober too.
^Not so bad... I think my throat is completely anesthetized

s0: ^Boy I need to talk to you.
^He doesn't even raise an eye on me.
s1: ^He sees me, but prefer to go back to cleaning his glasses. Asshole.

g-0: ^I know who you are. What do you want?

c-1: ^ I'm searching for a girl, kinda cute, she might have worked here.

c-2: ^ You'll see if I'm not in my place...

g-2: ^I'm sure this gentleman will remain calm now.

g-3: ^I know what you're here for darling.

c-6: ^ Do you? Cause I could swear that I'm here for you now darling.

g-5: ^I think you heard me well darling.

^(A hidden door. What a good detective I am...)

^(I see in his eyes that I found it.)
^(He goes to a wall and knocks on it.)
^(The wall pivots, and he seems to whisper something to the person that is behind.)
^(He nearly drags me through the door.)
^(Now I'm really in the Condor Club)

s0: ^Let's see what that woman has to say about it.
s1: ^Let's see what that woman has to say about <color=red>Margaret</color>.

c-0: ^ We found her dead at one of <color=red>Abati</color>'s man's apartment. With the said man also dead.

b: ^But let's back up a second, how do you know who I am?
^ Wait, how do you know my name?

c-1: ^Don't be silly, you're like the Jewish dog of the mob.

b: ^But you're not here to talk about me. What happened to Cara?

g-0: ^Can I ask you something Mr. Rosenthal?
g-1: ^I can't say for sure, but the bullet that he took in the head would have prevented that.

c-5: ^What was she doing outside of the club last night.

^Usually yes, but she was supposed to go join a client that we know of.

c-0: ^ Of course, he's my prime suspect for now.

client_entrance: ^(So that's where Cara was supposed to come.)

g-0: ^(There never seems to be anybody in those fancy hotels.)

^I haven't left the room since <color=red>Cara</color> left!

g-4: ^I paid the Condor to have her for the whole night, but then after half an hour, he came to the door.

c-5: ^ Do you know where was this other client?

c-6: ^ Did you see what he looked like?

g-6: ^Looked like a normal fellow, not skinny but not fat.
^But he was quite large, about one or two heads above me.
^So cold... A pair of pale green eyes.
^They could kill you, even without a gun under your nose.

c-7: ^ Why don't you act like a man?

^Then you'll see what man you are.
c-8: ^Don't know if he's the devil, but for sure he's gonna join him in the end.

g-7: ^Do you know what he did to <color=red>Cara</color>?

c-9: ^ She was killed with another man, most likely by the man that you saw last night.

c-0: ^(Let's leave this man alone, I cannot do anything else for him.)
c-1: ^ Won't you stop weeping for a freakin' hooker? Jesus.

c-10: ^ Hm... she was sent by the Condor Club to another client, like the man said.
^What can I say, she was popular.
^But that's not really professional, the club will hear from me.

client_newinvestigation: ^(So our man went here, after taking the driver's car.)

^(A parking lot? No, most surely an auto wreck yard.)

^(I should check where he's living. But I guess that he'll not be there. Obviously.)
client_alreadydone: ^(I can't do anything else for that man.)

wreckyard_entrance: ^(I couldn't imagine a place like that in San Francisco.)
^(It looks like I'm not in the city anymore.)
^(Let's check if they saw the car.)

c-1: ^ Did someone drop a car here last night? Like an old grey pick-up truck, or something like that.
^It was my shift last night, I thought the communists were bombing us. Freakin' pinkoes.

^Only saw him when he escaped the facility.

^Could only see his hair. Grey ones, with a kind of medium cut.
c-2: ^ I'm looking for someone that could have come here last night, does it ring a bell?
^Indeed there was a man that came here.
^He nearly banged the gate with a car, like a grey, rusty pick-up truck.
^Is that the one you're looking for?
^Seems to be. Tall guy? With tattoos?
^He seemed tall yes, but I couldn't see if he had tattoos or not.
^I could only see the back of his head when he escaped the wreck yard.
^Something like a medium cut, with grey hair.

g-1: ^Yeah, could have dropped the car anywhere in the yard, it's a hell of a jungle here.

c-3: ^ Can you guess where he could have dropped the car?
^I don't have weeks to find him.

g-2: ^Nothing else to do today, might as well help a police officer.

c-4: ^ I don't work with the police.
^So I'll ask you to stay discreet about what we could find.

g-3: ^I think so, it was not here yesterday.

c-5: ^ Let's see what we can find in here.

g-4: ^Yes, he's one of the men that I was hoping to find.
^(So our killer whacked the driver, and put him in the trunk.)
^(Or Russian, I really need to find our man, before he causes more damage to the organization.)
g-5: ^(There's nothing more on that poor guy.)
^Never had a dead body in my yard.
^Don't worry, I'll send someone to get rid of the body.

c-7: ^ I'll take a look inside, see if our man dropped something.

g-6: ^(Pretty neat interior for a wrecked car. That man is right, it was faked.)
^(Could have been left by the killer.)
^(I need to get out of here, before real cops show up.)
^Alright sir, my work here is done, I'll go back to the precinct.
^But what do I do with the body?
^(Those people these days. That listen too much to the radio.)
^(They think that they can do police work.)
^(I'm curious to know how long that dumb man will stay near the body.)
^(So let's go over what we have.)
^(A killer that vanished in the nature. Most likely Russian.)
^(A driver, with a bullet in the head. Most likely dead.)
^(Not a really good lead to follow.)
^(All the people that I talked to saw some bits of the killer.)
^(Maybe I could try to compose a complete profile and go check on Gibbs.)
^(Those lazy cops need to get some work.)

killer_entrance: ^(What killer would keep his place so easily accessible?)

g-0: ^(Most of them in Russian. How did he manage to get so much of them?)

g-1: ^(Again, dozens of what looks like... restaurant menus?)
^(The rest of the apartment is quite clean.)
^(But again, not really surprising, this guy wouldn't come back after killing a guy.)
^(Time to go back to the office.)
^(Who did he spend time with, and where.)

drugstore_entrance: ^(Given the amount of receipts that I found at his apartment, Valery really spent a lot of time here.)
^(But there's nothing really interesting in this shop.)
^(No client, only one man behind the counter....)
^(He said nothing when I entered, but he keeps a close eye on me.)
^(He isn't the type of fellow that blends well in a drugstore.)

c-0: ^ (Let's see what this man is doing here.)
g-0: ^Hi, could you help me with something?
^Hello sir, of course, do you want to buy something?

c-1: ^ Of course, what else would I want in a drugstore?
c-2: ^ Actually I was hoping to ask you somet...
^I'm afraid that I cannot help you sir, have a good day.
^(But... He's chasing me out of the store!)
^(But what could that be? It must be linked to Chtcherbina's activities.)
^(How can I make this clerk talk?)

drugstore_validation: ^So what do you want to buy sir?
drugstore_validation_wrong: ^Sorry, but I don't think that we have that in store.
^(Without even letting me say a word, he ushers me out of the store. What the hell...)
drugstore_validation_cancel: ^I... I don't have anything specific in mind.
^Then I think that I will not be able to help you sir.

drugstore_validation1_good: ^I'd like a bottle of Irdin vodka please.
^Alright, we just received a shipment of that brand.
drugstore_validation3_good: ^I'll have a pack of Jack's cigarettes please.
^Sir, we don't have that in store.
drugstore_backroom: ^(I knew that this guy was hiding something!)
^(My guess is that it was Valery's first supplier.)
^I can't remember your face, although you know the password.
^How did you come across our store?

c-0: ^ A good pal, <color=red>Valery Chtcherbina</color>, couldn't stop talking about you.
^I had to see it with my own eyes.
c-1: ^I could swear that I could see a 'Two for one' coupon for your store!
^As you would understand, we like to keep a low profile.
^Always in the interest of our clients, of course.

c-2: ^I suppose that <color=red>Lanza</color> would love to come and visit this shop...
^I managed to put this business on its feet, without any problem.
^I want to keep it that way.
^Tell me what you know about <color=red>Chtcherbina</color> then.
^I think that I'm his only supplier, given the amount of weapon that he buys.
^When was the last time that he came here?
^About two days ago. Wanted a simple gun and ammo.
^Came with his car, a really noticeable Chebrillet Deluxe.
^Not really, he killed one of <color=red>Abati</color>'s capi.
^Can't say that it won't be good for business.
^All those Italians and Russians shooting each other...
^But now I'm afraid that I won't be of any help in your hunt.
^I don't want to take sides in this.
^That's not what I asked. I'll leave your shop, and you won't hear about me again.

drugstore_newinvestigation: ^(They really seem to be behind this.)
^(Why would they want to attack their allies?)

restaurant_entrance: ^(Given all junk that I found in his place, Chtcherbina seemed to be a regular customer of this place.)
^(Maybe he just liked the food here?)
^(Or it's a front for the mob...)
^(Please, let's hope that it's just the food.)

c-0: ^ (Let's get a taste of this place.)
g-0: ^(There's quite a lot of people in here.)

c-1: ^ (Maybe I can ask something to a waitress...)

g-1: ^(Nobody seems to be interested in taking my order.)
^I'm happy to finally meet you, Mr Rosenthal.

c-2: ^ Of course, but I really enjoy knowing who sits at my table.
^My restaurant, my rules. You won't need my name.
c-3: ^Of course. Chatting with me, of getting killed.

c-4: ^But I know that you're searching for him in the entire city.
^So don't try to make me angrier.
c-5: ^ What could make you believe that?
^Maybe the fact that you're looking for him all over the city.
^So don't try to make me angrier than I already am.

g-3: ^But why would I tell you what you already know?
^That you sent <color=red>Chtcherbina</color> to whack one of <color=red>Abati</color>'s capi.

c-6: ^ Ain't got nothing to say to that?
^In either case, the war with <color=red>Abati</color> seems inevitable.
^You wouldn't believe me if I told you that we have nothing to do with it.

g-4: ^I presume that you're with the Russian mob.
^You have everything to win from a weaker Italian family.
^But for the moment, we don't really need to take over.
^What <color=red>Valery</color> did, if he really did so, was not under my orders.
^Or anyone else that I could know of.
^<color=red>Valery</color> did this on his own, he was used to doing that.
^Allows him to make an extra buck or two.
^But the deal was that it would never impact us.
^Which is clearly not the case here.
^I allowed him to conduct his business in a safe environment like this one.
^As a matter of fact, he encountered someone here some days ago.

c-7: ^ Did you see the man that came to see him?

g-5: ^As I said, I don't want to be involved, so I left him alone.
^I only know that he operated from the docks, near The Embarcadero.
^As a gesture of good faith to you and <color=red>Abati</color>, I'll let you chase him.
^Now you'll have to excuse me, I have a restaurant to run.
^I don't expect to see you too much again Mr. Rosenthal.
^(It was quite a peaceful time in San Francisco, why trying to jeopardize that?)
^(Let's hope that I won't get caught in the middle of the fire.)
^(If that man told the truth, Chtcherbina worked on his own.)
^(Maybe I will find his track again at the docks.)

dockers_entrance: ^(On one of the longest docks in the world...)

g-0: ^Hello sir, how can I help you?

c-1: ^ I'm looking for a fellow that came here, tall guy, very Russian-type, does it ring a bell?

g-1: ^I'm sorry sir, but the piers are almost 3 miles long.

c-2: ^, I'm asking for your cooperation on that investigation.
c-3: ^No I'm not, I was looking for my pal <color=red>Valery</color>, he told me to meet him here.
^But he didn't give me the pier, and I'm not gonna run across the entire 3 miles.

g-2: ^The couple last days should be enough.
^As soon as I find what I'm looking for.
^Goodbye sir, and thanks for your help.

g-1: ^(I won't be able to pursue him... Crap!)
^(I'll try to run it by Gibbs, see if he can find something.)

c-2: ^ (So at least he won't escape me this time.)

g-2: ^(He took the bullet in the forehead.)
^(Dead right as it crushed his skull.)
g-3: ^(Then why killing him, with the job already done?)
^(They speak Russian... so that bastard sent someone to follow me after all.)

^I'll get you back home. Who's this guy?

^I wouldn't give it a lot of thoughts.

^(But I can't shake off the feeling that it stinks.)
^(Now it's been like 3 days since the shooting.)
^(Given what I heard, Abati and his men are on the path to war.)
^(They put me back in the closet. I'm not a fighter.)
^(Please, make it only be a jealous husband...)

c-4: ^ Bugsy Rosenthal, private eye, what can I do for you?

g-4: ^He told me that you had some reservations about what we're about to do.
^I don't know if I'm the best to advise you.
^I don't think that the Russians are behind this.
^I know for a fact that we have a traitor.
^How can you be so sure about it?
^Only a few people knew about the fact that <color=red>Giovanni</color> would take the blame for <color=red>Lima</color>.
^I happen to be one of them.
^But... how can one of them betray the family?
^I really don't know. That's why I need you.
^You'll need to find out if one of them is linked with all this.
^When you find something, come to The Little Door Restaurant. I'll meet you there.
^This war will cost us a lot, I cannot afford another mistake.
^You'll still attack the Russians? It's madness!
^Let's hope that we'll at least eliminate one threat.
^(So one of the members of the administration is behind that.)
^(Right now I only have a license plate, and a pile of objects and documents.)
^(And an even bigger pile of bodies.)
^(What's the big picture behind all that?)

start_ending: ^(Why do I end up in this?)
^(But I guess it's too late now.)
^Hello again, Mr. Rosenthal. Can you follow me please?
^Sorry that I couldn't meet you sooner.
^You can go now, <color=red>Rossini</color>. I'll call you if we need anything.
^Here we are Bugsy. On the verge of war with the Russians.
^But most important, we're at war with ourselves.
badchoice_proofs: ^We pay you good money Bugsy, don't try to fuck me.
^Let's try it one more time, but I swear, I'll kill you if you don't take it seriously.
good_ending: ^So you see that letter that we found at <color=red>Giovanni</color>'s apartment?
^I first thought it was from a woman.
^Turns out it had the same handwriting as the note that we found on the killer's body.
^It makes sense that whoever wrote that letter, also saw the killer, and possibly asked him to kill <color=red>Giovanni</color>.
^See the partial phone number, just under the tear on the tearing on the killer's note?
^It's the same on that business card...
^I intend to keep it that way.

c-0: ^I'm pretty sure that you have an idea about that.
^We can't tolerate such a disgrace in our ranks.
^Even if he's one of the founders of our family.
c-1: ^I don't like to be taken for a schmuck, and it seems that <color=red>Morello</color> only saw me like that.
^I think that I can give you that.
^I called a meeting of the administration.
^Your two suspects were on another room, they came just after you.
^So that conclude our collaboration for now Bugsy.
^It's not that I don't like you, but when I see you it's after a tragedy.
^And I would like to prevent that.
^No offense, but when I'm around Italians, I can't stop watching over my shoulder now.
g-0: ^But you don't have to worry about it anymore.
^Finally! I can't survive around Italians it seems.
^Always a witty comment. I really don't know how you managed to survive.
^(Without a big win, or an epic climax.)
^(I could swear that I heard a gunshot when I left.)

c-2: ^ (I didn't expect to find a new work so soon.)

g-1: ^Bugsy Rosenthal, private eye, what can I do for you?
^Just wanted to thank you. You really pulled this off.
^I hate to say this, but you saved us on this.
^Otherwise we would have been in a really ugly war.
^I think those methods are better left in the past.
^Anyway, I'll stop following you from now.
^You can go back to sleep, I won't bother you at 3AM from now.

discussion_morello: ^(Abati leaves, without even looking at me.)
^(I'm already in the past for him.)
^(He's replaced by an old man, pale, but still proud.)
^(Yet, only the shadow of who Morello was.)
^So we meet one last time it seems, Bugsy.
^I know. And to be honest, I'm kinda relieved.
^No, it was the first time for me.
^He asked me to change the administration decision about sending him in prison to save <color=red>Lima</color>.
^But I couldn't, it would draw too much suspicion over us.
^So he threatened to go public about our relation.
^How is this situation relieving then? You got caught.
^Because I had to hide. I felt like a prey, never able to live my life.
^I only hope that <color=red>Giovanni</color> will forgive me.
^(I knew leaving that room that nobody would see Morello alive anymore.)
^(In fact, I think that I heard a muffled gunshot when I left the place.)

c-0: ^ (I didn't expect to find a new work so soon.)
g-0: ^Bugsy Rosenthal, private eye, what can I do for you?
^Just wanted to thank you. You really pulled this off.
^I hate to say this, but you saved us on this.
^Otherwise we would have been in a really ugly war.
^I think those methods are better left in the past.
^Anyway, I'll stop following you from now.
^You can go back to sleep, I won't bother you at 3AM from now.

bad_ending: ^You're just a drunk, tired, and useless man.
^(Only thing I saw was the face of Rossini.)
^(No anger in his eyes. No shame either.)
^(I don't know if the death coming over me was blowing up my brain, but I could swear that he tried to tell me something.)
lanza_ending: ^Go back home Bugsy. You won't have to see such a disgrace.
^(I could swear that what I saw in Abati's eyes was sadness.)
^(Except that Abati and the others seem to avoid talking to me.)
^(It should be a victory. For me, for the family.)
